reviewText: I couldn't finish either of these!! They were sooo stupid.. The characters in Oliver Twist were very unbelievable and just stupid and Little Dorit wasn't much better... I didn't even finish the first episode of Oliver Twist!!! I thought Little Dorit sounded really cute but I was VERY disappointed... When I started watching it I was so bored I never finished the whole series.. Maybe it was gonna get better but it wasn't worth keeping to find out!!!  Wouldn't recommend these to anyone!!!!!

reviewText: THE SET OF 'LITTLE DORRIT' AND 'OLIVER TWIST' WITH WHAT IS NOW KNOWN AS 'THE BBC AUSTEN/DICKENS STOCK COMPANY' HAVE ONCE AGAIN PUT TOGETHER A FINE AND SOMETIMES LONG, YET MOST ENJOYABLE LITERARY CLASSICS TO THE SMALL SCREEN VIA THE LIKES OF WRITER ANDREW DAVIES AND OTHER TALENT, THAT ONCE PLAYED ON THE VARIOUS BRITISH (TELLY) TELEVISION OUTLETS, THEN IN AMERICA ON PUBLIC TV WITH: 'MASTERPIECE THEATER'.ALL BRITISH PRODUCTIONS (AS IT VERY WELL SHOULD BE!) WITH NO OUTSIDE INTRUSIONS (EXCEPT FOR AN OCCASIONAL AUSTRALIAN ACTOR BUTTING IN!), THESE 2 CHARLES DICKENS STORIES ARE KEEPERS! SO WELL DONE, CAM BE WATCHED MANY TIMES TO THE SAME EFFECT, AS WITH THE OTHER SET WITH 'BLEAK HOUSE' AND 'THE OLD CURIOSITY SHOP' - TOP NOTCH QUALITY VIEWING!!
summary: "THIS SET FROM THE BBC - MOST EXCELLENT STORY TELLING!!!! . . . "

Title: N/A

reviewText: Oh how I loved this.A faithful adaptation-not surprisingly from the BBC.All actors shine-I loved Matthew Macfadyen especially-his confusion and frustration are so clear-and little Dorrit herself is wonderful-I felt in the book she was just "too good" But true to Dickens form,she needs to be for us to notice the other characters defects.Greed,pride,wealth,status-all fall victim to it.More than a few die because of it-but Amy Dorrit manages to keep her head and recognize what is truely important-it seems no one could have survived her life without her focus-Dickens knew about her world-his father was in the Marshalsea debtors prison for a time.True to the BBC,the costumes and locations are true to the era-the story is compelling-I dare you to try and not root for Amy!Have a long afternoon free and watch the whole thing without a break-it is time well spent

reviewText: I saw this program on TV and wanted to share it with someone else who had not. This is a terrific adaptation on one of Dickens' most thought provoking novels. The cast is superb and the script as close to perfect as an adaptation can get. This may be Tom Courtney's finest performance. I have literally grown up watching him and have identified with him since Billy Liar. The complexity of Mr. Dorrit's character does great credit to his craft.
summary: Great script, great performances, based on one of Dickens' best.

reviewText: The world was given a gift when Charles Dickens was born!! and over 100 years later we are still enjoying his stories. Little Dorrit is one of my all time favorite of his books and Andrew Davies did an AMAZING job bringing it to life. I highly recommend anyone who enjoys costume dramas or Dickens stories to buy this collectors set.
